Abstract.

In [GP2] we constructed a new class of Iwasawa modules as â„“â„“\ellâ€“adic realizations of what we called abstract â„“â„“\ellâ€“adic 111â€“motives in the number field setting. We proved in loc. cit. that the new Iwasawa modules satisfy an equivariant main conjecture. In this paper we link the new modules to the â„“â„“\ellâ€“adified Tate canonical class, defined by Tate in 1960 [Ta1] and give an explicit construction of (the minus part of) â„“â„“\ellâ€“adic Tate sequences for any Galois CM extension K/kğ¾ğ‘˜K/k of an arbitrary totally real number field kğ‘˜k. These explicit constructions are significant and useful in their own right but also due to their applications (via results in [GP2]) to a proof of the minus part of the far reaching Equivariant Tamagawa Number Conjecture for the Artin motive associated to the Galois extension K/kğ¾ğ‘˜K/k.

As in [GPff], we will approach the question of linking Câˆ™superscriptğ¶âˆ™C^{\bullet} to the Tate class from two sides. (3) The rest of the argument taken from [Bu1] is entirely cohomological algebra, so there is no difference between the function field and number field cases in this respect.

Finally, we combine (8) with Lemma 5.8 to get the isomorphism in the statement of the above theorem.â€ƒQ. E. D.

6. Examples

We finish this paper by sketching one or two examples, without going into detail too deeply. The main purpose is twofold: to have a certain reality check on our results, and to give the reader a feeling what is going on.

We choose a setting that is as simple as possible. Let k=â„šğ‘˜â„šk=\mathbb{Q} and K+superscriptğ¾K^{+} the cubic field of conductor 7. We take â„“=3â„“3\ell=3. For Sğ‘†S we consistently take the set of ramified primes in K/kğ¾ğ‘˜K/k together with the 3-adic primes; the contribution of the places over 555 (resp.Â 37) and of the infinite places disappears in the minus part. For Tğ‘‡T we take the set of places in Kğ¾K above any totally split place in K/kğ¾ğ‘˜K/k. In both cases, 7 is split in Lğ¿L and ramified in K/Lğ¾ğ¿K/L. Moreover Î¶3subscriptğœ3\zeta_{3} is not contained in Kâˆsubscriptğ¾K_{\infty}. Final remark on the first case: Since the toric part has no Î“Î“\Gamma-invariants, and the lattice part of Mğ‘€M has rank one, it follows that the module of Î“Î“\Gamma-invariants in M0:=Tâ„“â€‹(Câˆ)assignsubscriptğ‘€0subscriptğ‘‡â„“subscriptğ¶M_{0}:=T_{\ell}(C_{\infty}) has rank one.
